required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Telmisartan 80mg+Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 25 mg in Hypertension: an Observational Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Descriptive Pharmaco-epidemiological Study of a Hypertensive Patient Population Treated With a Fixed-dose Combination of Telmisartan 80 mg and Hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg and of Conditions for the Management of Arterial Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: It is a national, retrospective , observational study in hypertensive patients treated for at least 8 weeks with the fixed dose combination of telmisartan 80 mg and hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg. The primary objective is to assess the control rate (systolic and diastolic blood pressure). Key secondary objectives are to assess the blood pressure reduction after at least 8 weeks of treatment, describe the population treated with this new fixed dose combination

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of BP Control in Hypertensive Patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to a minimum of 8 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of controlled Patients at the Study End. Control rate of hypertension in general practice and in cardiology defined as systolic blood pressure (SBP) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP) <140/90 mmHg for unselected hypertensive patients and SBP and DBP <130/80 mmHg for hypertensive patients at high cardiovascular risk (patients with diabetes and patients with impaired renal function) as defined in the recommendations of the French National Health Authority (HAS) 2005 guidelines.

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) After at Least 8 Weeks of Treatment in Overall Study Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to a minimum of 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean SBP measured at the Study End

secondary_outcome.measure: Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) After at Least 8 Weeks of Treatment in Overall Study Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to a minimum of 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean DBP measured at the Study End

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) After at Least 8 Weeks of Treatment in Population at High Cardiovascular Risk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to a minimum of 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean SBP measured at the Study End

secondary_outcome.measure: Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) After at Least 8 Weeks of Treatment in Population at High Cardiovascular Risk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to a minimum of 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean DBP measured at the Study End

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of BP Control by Risk Factor According to the Recommendations ESH/ESC 2007
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to a minimum of 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with blood pressure (BP) control, per risk factor. High risk factors determined according to the recommendations of the ESH/ESC 2007.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Hypertensives
- Treated for at least 8 weeks with the fixed dose combination of telmisartan 80 mg and hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg
Exclusion criteria:
- Treated with the combination less than 8 weeks

group.title: Telmisartan (T) 80mg/Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 25 mg
group.description: Patients treated at least 8 weeks with Fixed Dose Combination (FDC)

group.title: Telmisartan (T) 80mg/Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 25 mg
group.description: Patients treated at least 8 weeks with Fixed Dose Combination (FDC)

measure.title: Hypertension treatments prescribed prior to initiation of treatment
measure.description: Hypertension treatments prescribed prior to initiation of treatment with telmisartan 80mg in a FDC with HCTZ 25 mg

measure.title: Conditions for prescribing 80 mg telmisartan in fixed combination with 25 mg HCTZ
measure.description: Conditions for prescribing 80 mg telmisartan in fixed combination with 25 mg HCTZ were , "Lack of efficacy of previous treatments" and "To decrease the number of treatment administration throughout the day"

class.title: To decrease the number of treatment

measure.title: Cardiovascular risk factors (including the existence of a metabolic syndrome)
measure.description: Number of Patients used in the analysis for Cardiovascular risk factors (including the existence of a metabolic syndrome) were 322 Participants with existence of a metabolic syndrome

outcome.title: Rate of BP Control in Hypertensive Patients
outcome.description: Percentage of controlled Patients at the Study End. Control rate of hypertension in general practice and in cardiology defined as systolic blood pressure (SBP) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP) <140/90 mmHg for unselected hypertensive patients and SBP and DBP <130/80 mmHg for hypertensive patients at high cardiovascular risk (patients with diabetes and patients with impaired renal function) as defined in the recommendations of the French National Health Authority (HAS) 2005 guidelines.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to a minimum of 8 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: Descriptive statistical analysis was performed for the entire study population on the FAS in intention-to-treat (ITT) as well as on the Per protocol set (PPS) in per protocol (PP). The difference between the numbers of patients was inferior than 10% ; the results of the primary objective was presented in PPS.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
